intro: Eriocaulon intermedium var. brevicaule, commonly known as the short-stalked flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
